com.hp.autonomy.hod.client.token

Interface TokenRepository

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InMemoryTokenRepository

    public interface TokenRepository
    A TokenRepository stores tokens such that they can be refreshed as instructed by HP Haven OnDemand. Note that the token retrieved by the get method may not be the same token that was originally inserted, but will have the same capabilities. Repositories may automatically remove expired tokens

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AuthenticationToken get(TokenProxy key)
      Retrieve the token associated with the given key
      TokenProxy insert(AuthenticationToken token)
      Insert a token into the repository for later retrieval
      AuthenticationToken remove(TokenProxy key)
      Removes the token associated with the given key
      AuthenticationToken update(TokenProxy key, AuthenticationToken newToken)
      Update the token in the repository associated with the given key.

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        TokenProxy insert(AuthenticationToken token)
                  throws IOException
        Insert a token into the repository for later retrieval
        Parameters:
        token - The AuthenticationToken to store
        Returns:
        A key which can be used to retrieve the token
        Throws:
        IOException - If an IO error occurred inserting the token
        IllegalArgumentException - If the token has expired

      • update

        AuthenticationToken update(TokenProxy key,
                         AuthenticationToken newToken)
                           throws IOException
        Update the token in the repository associated with the given key. If the key is not in the repository, the new token will not be stored
        Parameters:
        key - The key to associate with the token
        newToken - The new token for the key
        Returns:
        The old token associated with the key, or null if no key was associated
        Throws:
        IOException - If an IO error occurred updating the token
        IllegalArgumentException - If the token has expired

      • get

        AuthenticationToken get(TokenProxy key)
                        throws IOException
        Retrieve the token associated with the given key
        Parameters:
        key - The key with which to retrieve a token
        Returns:
        The token associated with the key, or null if no token is associated with the key
        Throws:
        IOException - If an IO error occurred retrieving the token

      • remove

        AuthenticationToken remove(TokenProxy key)
                           throws IOException
        Removes the token associated with the given key
        Parameters:
        key - The key for which a token should be removed
        Returns:
        The old token associated with the key
        Throws:
        IOException - If an IO error occurred removing the token
